speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: SCENE II. Another room in the same.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Enter Provost and a Servant

speaker: Servant
text_entry: He's hearing of a cause; he will come straight

speaker: Servant
text_entry: I'll tell him of you.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Pray you, do.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: Provost
text_entry: I'll know

speaker: Provost
text_entry: His pleasure; may be he will relent. Alas,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: He hath but as offended in a dream!

speaker: Provost
text_entry: All sects, all ages smack of this vice; and he

speaker: Provost
text_entry: To die for't!

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Enter ANGELO

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Now, what's the matter. Provost?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Is it your will Claudio shall die tomorrow?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Did not I tell thee yea? hadst thou not order?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Why dost thou ask again?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Lest I might be too rash:

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Under your good correction, I have seen,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: When, after execution, judgment hath

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Repented o'er his doom.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Go to; let that be mine:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Do you your office, or give up your place,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And you shall well be spared.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: I crave your honour's pardon.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: What shall be done, sir, with the groaning Juliet?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: She's very near her hour.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Dispose of her

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To some more fitter place, and that with speed.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Re-enter Servant

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Here is the sister of the man condemn'd

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Desires access to you.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Hath he a sister?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Ay, my good lord; a very virtuous maid,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: And to be shortly of a sisterhood,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: If not already.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Well, let her be admitted.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: See you the fornicatress be removed:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Let have needful, but not lavish, means;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: There shall be order for't.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Enter ISABELLA and LUCIO

speaker: Provost
text_entry: God save your honour!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Stay a little while.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To ISABELLA

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: You're welcome: what's your will?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I am a woeful suitor to your honour,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Please but your honour hear me.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Well; what's your suit?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: There is a vice that most I do abhor,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And most desire should meet the blow of justice;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: For which I would not plead, but that I must;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: For which I must not plead, but that I am

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: At war 'twixt will and will not.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Well; the matter?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I have a brother is condemn'd to die:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I do beseech you, let it be his fault,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And not my brother.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: [Aside]  Heaven give thee moving graces!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Condemn the fault and not the actor of it?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Why, every fault's condemn'd ere it be done:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Mine were the very cipher of a function,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To fine the faults whose fine stands in record,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And let go by the actor.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O just but severe law!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I had a brother, then. Heaven keep your honour!

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]  Give't not o'er so: to him

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: again, entreat him;

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Kneel down before him, hang upon his gown:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: You are too cold; if you should need a pin,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: You could not with more tame a tongue desire it:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: To him, I say!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Must he needs die?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Maiden, no remedy.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Yes; I do think that you might pardon him,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And neither heaven nor man grieve at the mercy.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I will not do't.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: But can you, if you would?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Look, what I will not, that I cannot do.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: But might you do't, and do the world no wrong,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: If so your heart were touch'd with that remorse

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: A s mine is to him?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: He's sentenced; 'tis too late.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]  You are too cold.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Too late? why, no; I, that do speak a word.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: May call it back again. Well, believe this,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: No ceremony that to great ones 'longs,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Not the king's crown, nor the deputed sword,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: The marshal's truncheon, nor the judge's robe,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Become them with one half so good a grace

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As mercy does.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: If he had been as you and you as he,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: You would have slipt like him; but he, like you,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Would not have been so stern.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Pray you, be gone.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I would to heaven I had your potency,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And you were Isabel! should it then be thus?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: No; I would tell what 'twere to be a judge,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And what a prisoner.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Ay, touch him; there's the vein.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Your brother is a forfeit of the law,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And you but waste your words.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Alas, alas!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Why, all the souls that were were forfeit once;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And He that might the vantage best have took

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Found out the remedy. How would you be,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: If He, which is the top of judgment, should

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: But judge you as you are? O, think on that;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And mercy then will breathe within your lips,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Like man new made.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Be you content, fair maid;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: It is the law, not I condemn your brother:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Were he my kinsman, brother, or my son,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: It should be thus with him: he must die tomorrow.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To-morrow! O, that's sudden! Spare him, spare him!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: He's not prepared for death. Even for our kitchens

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: We kill the fowl of season: shall we serve heaven

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: With less respect than we do minister

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To our gross selves? Good, good my lord, bethink you;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Who is it that hath died for this offence?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: There's many have committed it.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]           Ay, well said.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: The law hath not been dead, though it hath slept:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Those many had not dared to do that evil,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: If the first that did the edict infringe

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Had answer'd for his deed: now 'tis awake

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Takes note of what is done; and, like a prophet,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Looks in a glass, that shows what future evils,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Either new, or by remissness new-conceived,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And so in progress to be hatch'd and born,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Are now to have no successive degrees,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: But, ere they live, to end.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Yet show some pity.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I show it most of all when I show justice;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: For then I pity those I do not know,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Which a dismiss'd offence would after gall;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And do him right that, answering one foul wrong,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Lives not to act another. Be satisfied;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Your brother dies to-morrow; be content.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: So you must be the first that gives this sentence,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And he, that suffer's. O, it is excellent

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To have a giant's strength; but it is tyrannous

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To use it like a giant.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]   That's well said.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Could great men thunder

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As Jove himself does, Jove would ne'er be quiet,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: For every pelting, petty officer

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Would use his heaven for thunder;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Nothing but thunder! Merciful Heaven,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Thou rather with thy sharp and sulphurous bolt

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Split'st the unwedgeable and gnarled oak

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Than the soft myrtle: but man, proud man,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Drest in a little brief authority,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Most ignorant of what he's most assured,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: His glassy essence, like an angry ape,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Plays such fantastic tricks before high heaven

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As make the angels weep; who, with our spleens,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Would all themselves laugh mortal.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]  O, to him, to him, wench! he

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: will relent;

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: He's coming; I perceive 't.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: [Aside]  Pray heaven she win him!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: We cannot weigh our brother with ourself:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Great men may jest with saints; 'tis wit in them,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: But in the less foul profanation.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Thou'rt i' the right, girl; more o, that.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That in the captain's but a choleric word,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Which in the soldier is flat blasphemy.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]  Art avised o' that? more on 't.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Why do you put these sayings upon me?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Because authority, though it err like others,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Hath yet a kind of medicine in itself,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That skins the vice o' the top. Go to your bosom;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Knock there, and ask your heart what it doth know

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That's like my brother's fault: if it confess

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: A natural guiltiness such as is his,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Let it not sound a thought upon your tongue

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Against my brother's life.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: [Aside]                  She speaks, and 'tis

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Such sense, that my sense breeds with it. Fare you well.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Gentle my lord, turn back.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I will bethink me: come again tomorrow.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Hark how I'll bribe you: good my lord, turn back.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: How! bribe me?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Ay, with such gifts that heaven shall share with you.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]  You had marr'd all else.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Not with fond shekels of the tested gold,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Or stones whose rates are either rich or poor

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As fancy values them; but with true prayers

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That shall be up at heaven and enter there

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Ere sun-rise, prayers from preserved souls,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: From fasting maids whose minds are dedicate

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To nothing temporal.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Well; come to me to-morrow.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]  Go to; 'tis well; away!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Heaven keep your honour safe!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: [Aside] Amen:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: For I am that way going to temptation,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Where prayers cross.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: At what hour to-morrow

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Shall I attend your lordship?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: At any time 'fore noon.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: 'Save your honour!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Exeunt ISABELLA, LUCIO, and Provost

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: From thee, even from thy virtue!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: What's this, what's this? Is this her fault or mine?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: The tempter or the tempted, who sins most?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Ha!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Not she: nor doth she tempt: but it is I

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That, lying by the violet in the sun,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Do as the carrion does, not as the flower,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Corrupt with virtuous season. Can it be

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That modesty may more betray our sense

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Than woman's lightness? Having waste ground enough,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Shall we desire to raze the sanctuary

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And pitch our evils there? O, fie, fie, fie!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: What dost thou, or what art thou, Angelo?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Dost thou desire her foully for those things

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That make her good? O, let her brother live!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Thieves for their robbery have authority

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: When judges steal themselves. What, do I love her,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That I desire to hear her speak again,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And feast upon her eyes? What is't I dream on?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: O cunning enemy, that, to catch a saint,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: With saints dost bait thy hook! Most dangerous

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Is that temptation that doth goad us on

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To sin in loving virtue: never could the strumpet,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: With all her double vigour, art and nature,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Once stir my temper; but this virtuous maid

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Subdues me quite. Even till now,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: When men were fond, I smiled and wonder'd how.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Exit
